TopicTitle: Crashed ships embed in the ground.

Articles.Content:
The title says it all, i saw a post on the reddit of a bugged ship (that i can't find now that i'm making this post.) stuck half way in the ground.

Edited September 9, 2013 by rjamesking

I think they said that type of thing isn't going to happen, though we all agree that it'd be hilarious and awesome. If I recall correctly(which I sometimes don't), they said the most we'll see is a type of 3D decal at impact sites. Probably be temporary, too, little explosion crater.

The main start-up screen is the big teaser here! Muner lander partly sticking out of the Mun! Very funny!

I'd like to see this too, but Beeman is right, a simpler crater would be easier on the engine.

Is this really a suggestion ("Hey cool, lets have have ships embed in the ground! That would be cool!")?

Or was this meant as a bug report ("It's not good that ships embed in the ground. Can this be fixed?")?
I thought Unity couldn't handle dynamic terrain deformation?
What unity can't do now is slightly irrelevant 'cause it may well be very easy to do in Unity by next year(when the game should be nearing completion).
